shortdesc.ph: Plays the specified local or online audio effect file.

p.codeblock: public abstract int playEffect(int soundId, String filePath, int loopCount, double pitch, double pan, double gain, boolean publish);

section.p: This method supports playing URI files that start with content://. For supported audio file formats, see [What audio file formats does the Agora RTC SDK support](https://doc.shengwang.cn/faq/general-product-inquiry/audio-format). If the local music file does not exist, the SDK does not support the file format, or the music file URL cannot be accessed, the SDK reports AUDIO_MIXING_REASON_CAN_NOT_OPEN.
section.note: If you need to play an online audio effect file, it is recommended to cache it to the local device first, preload the file into memory using preloadEffect, and then call this method to play the effect. Otherwise, playback may fail or be silent due to timeout or loading failure.

section.title: Timing
section.p: You can call this method before or after joining a channel.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: After the audio effect file finishes playing, the SDK triggers the callback.

plentry.pd: Audio effect ID. Each audio effect file must have a unique ID.

Path of the audio effect file. The following formats are supported:
URI address starting with content://
Path starting with /assets/
URL
Absolute path of a local file (must include file name and extension) Supported audio formats include MP3, AAC, M4A, MP4, WAV, and 3GP.

Number of times the audio effect loops:
â‰¥ 0: Number of times to play. For example, 1 means loop once, i.e., play twice in total.
-1: Loop the audio file indefinitely.
Pitch of the audio effect. The range is from 0.5 to 2.0. The default value is 1.0, which represents the original pitch. The smaller the value, the lower the pitch.

Spatial position of the audio effect. The range is from -1.0 to 1.0:
-1.0: Audio effect comes from the user's left.
0.0: Audio effect comes from the front.
1.0: Audio effect comes from the user's right.
Volume of the audio effect. The range is from 0.0 to 100.0. The default value is 100.0, which represents the original volume. The smaller the value, the lower the volume.

Whether to publish the audio effect to remote users:
: Publish the audio effect to remote users. Both local and remote users can hear it.
: Do not publish the audio effect to remote users. Only the local user can hear it.
